Package moulton.scalable.visuals

Class ImageButton

  • java.lang.Object
    • moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
      • moulton.scalable.clickables.Clickable
        • moulton.scalable.clickables.RadioButton
          • moulton.scalable.visuals.ImageButton
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TouchResponsiveComponent
    public class ImageButton
extends RadioButton
    A button that displays an image instead of text on its button face.
    Author:
    Matthew Moulton

    • Field Detail

      • image

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage image
        The image drawn on the face of the button when not clicked.
        See Also:
        setImage(BufferedImage)

      • touchedImage

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage touchedImage
        The image to draw on the face of the button when touched. If none specified, the normal image will be used.
        See Also:
        setTouchedImage(BufferedImage)

      • clickedImage

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage clickedImage
        The image to draw on the face of the button when clicked. If none specified, the touched image will be used, unless that is not specified, in which case the normal image will be used.
        See Also:
        setClickedImage(BufferedImage)

      • width

        protected java.lang.String width
        The algebraic equations to determine the bounds of this button.

      • height

        protected java.lang.String height
        The algebraic equations to determine the bounds of this button.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageButton

        public ImageButton​(java.lang.String id,
                   java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                   Panel parent,
                   java.lang.String x,
                   java.lang.String y,
                   java.lang.String width,
                   java.lang.String height,
                   java.awt.Color background)
        Parameters:
        id - a unique string designed to identify this component when an event occurs.
        img - the image to draw as the face of the button
        parent - the panel that this image button will reside upon.
        x - the x coordinate on the screen, given in menu component value format
        y - the y coordinate on the screen, given in menu component value format
        width - the width of the component, given in menu component value format
        height - the height of the component, given in menu component value format
        background - if the image does not fill up the entire button face, this fill color is used for the rest

      • ImageButton

        public ImageButton​(java.lang.String id,
                   java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                   Panel parent,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   java.awt.Color background)
        Parameters:
        id - a unique string designed to identify this component when an event occurs.
        img - the BufferedImage to draw
        parent - the panel that this button will reside upon
        x - the integer x coordinate this button should appear on its panel
        y - the integer y coordinate this button should appear on its panel
        background - the background color for the box when editable

      • render

        public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                   int xx,
                   int yy,
                   int ww,
                   int hh)
        Draws on the graphics object to represent this image button. The button will be bounded by either the MenuComponent.x, MenuComponent.y, width, and height algebraic expressions or by the grid of MenuComponent.parent. It will draw the image dictated by getDrawImage() in those bounds in the original aspect ratio. Any space not covered by the drawing of the image will be filled with RadioButton.color
        Specified by:
        render in class MenuComponent
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object to draw on
        ww - the width of this component's container or MenuComponent.parent that will be drawn on.
        hh - the height of this component's container or MenuComponent.parent that will be drawn on.
        xx - the x-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
        yy - the y-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins

      • getDrawImage

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage getDrawImage()
        Returns the image to draw. If the button is neither touched nor clicked, then the normal image will be used. If the button is clicked, the clicked image will be used if there is one. If there is not, the touched image will be used if there is one. If the button is touched, then the touch image will be used if there is one.
        Returns:
        the appropriate image to draw on the button's face

      • setTouched

        public void setTouched​(boolean touched)
        Description copied from interface: TouchResponsiveComponent
        When the MenuManager is processing mouse movement, the results of TouchResponsiveComponent.isTouchedAt(int, int) for the coordinates of the mouse will be passed through this method to update whether this component is touched. Therefore, this method is responsible for informing the component whether it is touched, whatever effect that may have.
        Specified by:
        setTouched in interface TouchResponsiveComponent
        Overrides:
        setTouched in class Clickable
        Parameters:
        touched - whether the component is touched by the mouse: Clickable.touched.

      • setTouchedColor

        public void setTouchedColor​(java.awt.Color touchedColor)
        If touchedColor is null and the touchedImage is null, the outline toggle will be used to show touch.
        Parameters:
        touchedColor - the new touched color
